body:
<!-- Thanks for filing an issue! Before hitting the button, please answer these questions.-->

**Is this a request for help?** (If yes, you should use our troubleshooting guide and community support channels, see http://kubernetes.io/docs/troubleshooting/.):


**What keywords did you search in Kubernetes issues before filing this one?** (If you have found any duplicates, you should instead reply there.):

`kubectl get`
`-o name`

---

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?** (choose one):

bug

<!--
If this is a BUG REPORT, please:
  - Fill in as much of the template below as you can.  If you leave out
    information, we can't help you as well.

If this is a FEATURE REQUEST, please:
  - Describe *in detail* the feature/behavior/change you'd like to see.

In both cases, be ready for followup questions, and please respond in a timely
manner.  If we can't reproduce a bug or think a feature already exists, we
might close your issue.  If we're wrong, PLEASE feel free to reopen it and
explain why.
-->

**Kubernetes version** (use `kubectl version`):

```
$ k version
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"7+", GitVersion:"v1.7.0-alpha.2.45+06d6a9ec4825c8", GitCommit:"06d6a9ec4825c886b04869dd43a312e15f0528b1", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2017-04-20T16:37:31Z", GoVersion:"go1.7.5", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"7+", GitVersion:"v1.7.0-alpha.2.45+06d6a9ec4825c8", GitCommit:"06d6a9ec4825c886b04869dd43a312e15f0528b1", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2017-04-20T16:33:43Z", GoVersion:"go1.7.5", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```

**Environment**:
any

**What happened**:

When you use `kubectl get -o name` on a generic resource (ie, one in an API server outside the core), the output doesn't show the group information, though the generic implementation of `get` for the column format has the information:

```
$ k get serviceclasses user-provided-service
NAME                    KIND                                          BINDABLE   BROKER NAME   DESCRIPTION
user-provided-service   ServiceClass.v1alpha1.servicecatalog.k8s.io   false      ups-broker    A user provided service

$ k get serviceclasses user-provided-service -o name
<unknown>/user-provided-service
```

**What you expected to happen**:

```
$ k get serviceclasses user-provided-service
NAME                    KIND                                          BINDABLE   BROKER NAME   DESCRIPTION
user-provided-service   ServiceClass.v1alpha1.servicecatalog.k8s.io   false      ups-broker    A user provided service

$ k get serviceclasses user-provided-service -o name
serviceclasses/user-provided-service
```

**How to reproduce it** (as minimally and precisely as possible):

In this specific case, you can run the [`service-catalog` walkthrough](https://github.com/kubernetes-incubator/service-catalog/blob/master/docs/walkthrough.md).

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

title: kubectl get -o name doesn't show resource name information for generic resources
